Jeff I tottaly agree with your idea

Jeff <x_rauq_x@...> wrote:Hey all, rAuq here.

I read Cardhead's post, and figured I'd better reply to it with a 
suggestion, somewhat of a modification of an idea originally 
mentioned to me be LegendaryNemasis a long time ago.

If person A and person B happen to be online at the same time, (i 
suggest Yahoo Messenger, ICQ, MSN, or AIM - whichever you prefer - 
to coordinate this) A and B should send their posts privately to 
each other, then when either A or B wants to stop posting for now, 
copy paste all of the messages into one email, and post that 
combined email on the messageboard.

This should not, of course, be done when there is a battle 
situation, or when more than those two people's characters are 
involved.

For example, if BotA and BotB were having a conversation by 
themselves in a room in a base, doing the above mentioned method of 
grouped posting should most likely be done. If BotA and BotB are 
also talking to BotC, then there is a problem if BotA and BotB go 
off on a talking spree, while BotC is left behind.

With battle situations it becomes very apparent that there is a 
problem if several people start posting a lot more than other 
people. The battle can get rather bent out of shape as far as the 
time line is concerened.

I'm not giving any numbers just presenting the idea. Council and 
polls can sort out the rest, or discard the idea entirely. =)

-J

*the exhausted walking zombie... yea... something like that*

--- In nbwrpg@yahoogroups.com, "cardhead649" <cardhead649@y...> 
wrote:
> I'm really sorry it's come to this, but the obsession with having 
the 
> last word displayed by some members of the group is making it 
> virtually impossible for me to keep up with this RPG.  When I sign 
> on, all I ever see is strings of rapid-fire post exchanges between 
> two individuals, which generally leaves a few characters miles 
ahead 
> of everyone else in the timeline.  It's frustrating to find your 
> characters dropped by the wayside simply because your limited 
windows 
> of Internet time each day don't coincide with the rest of the 
group.
> 
> It's a great RPG on most fronts, but if this trend of forcing 
folks 
> like me to weed through 20-40 posts a day and desperately try to 
play 
> catch-up with our characters continues, well, you're going to be 
left 
> with one less member.  I simply don't have the time or the 
patience 
> to keep up with this much longer.  Those responsible for skewing 
this 
> RPG in an annoying, unfair, and unrealistic manner should know who 
> they are.
> 
> Council members, PLEASE put some sort of cap on the number of 
posts 
> per character each day.  If nothing else, it gives everyone a 
chance 
> to participate without fighting to get a word in edgewise.
